etymologies: late Middle English: from Old French heriter ‘inherit’, from ecclesiastical Latin hereditare, from Latin heres, hered- ‘heir’

definitions: (of a characteristic) transmissible from parent to offspring

examples.text: intelligence is to some degree heritable

shortDefinitions: (of characteristic) transmissible from parent to offspring

crossReferenceMarkers: Compare with movable (sense 2 of the adjective)
definitions: (of property) capable of being inherited by heirs-at-law

examples.text: heritable property was excluded from the valuation

shortDefinitions: (of property) capable of being inherited by heirs-at-law
